hanzi-su-wiki:
喬

Значения

Высокий

Мнемоника

Разглядывая высокое 高, надо закинуть голову назад 夭.

Варианты

乔
purpleculture_pinyin:
qiáo
surname Qiao; tall
фамилия Цяо; высокий
rtega_mnemonic:
喬喬RS
乔乔		tall, lofty, proud, stately
  • contr. 夭高 → 喬: high 高 as the sky 天; hold once head high = be proud and walk stately
 橋
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 乔)
Pictophonetic: 夭 indicates the sound; 高 (tall) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
喬木 [ qiáo mù ]: tree, esp. with recognizable trunk (as opposed to 灌木 , bush or shrub)
喬遷 [ qiáo qiān ]: to move (to a superior place); promotion
喬裝 [ qiáo zhuāng ]: to pretend; to feign; to disguise oneself
喬遷之喜 [ qiáo qiān zhī xǐ ]: congratulations on house-moving or promotion (idiom); Best wishes for your new home!
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 夭 [ yāo ] young, energetic; to die young
    • 高 [ gāo ] tall, lofty; high, elevated
heisig_chinese_memo: Angels go to classes at heaven-high. They quaff (drink heartily) their thirst for knowledge, sure that the instructors there will never give them a belt in the mouth, but only pretend to. Never at heaven-high!
Ru_Notes: Сравни: 高 (たかい、コウ высокий) — более распространено. Фонетик для ряда кандзи: 橋 (はし、キョウ мост), 矯 (ためる、キョウ выпрямлять), 驕 (おごる、キョウ заносчивость, гордость).
Ru_Radicals: ノ, 冂 (перевёрнутая коробка), 口 (рот), 大 (большой)
Ru_trainchinese: qiáo: (графема) высокий; переодеваться, рядиться (под кого-то)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the wide mouth (冋) who drinks (呑) is lofty
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: For fun you pretend to use crutches and that you will die young.
humanum_full_description_en:
The inscription of the word " Qiao " starts from ◎ "高". " Qiao " is a differentiated character of "高". The original meaning is Gao. Yu Xingwuyun: "The original meaning of Qiao is attached to the upper part of the word "Gao". It is used as a sign of the word to refer to things. It is distinguished from the word "Gao". Stop, force and other shapes.

Jin Wen expresses arrogance, which is equivalent to the " arrogance " in the literature. Xian Zhong: "I dare not be Qiao (arrogant)", Zhongshan Wang Ding: "If you are not rich, you can make Joe (arrogant)", "The Analects. "Xue Er": "Poor without flattery, rich without arrogance." "Qiao Qiao" means a strong and fierce appearance. The literature is used as "蹻蹻" or "Jiao Jiao". Xi Zhong: "Qiao Qiao Qilong", which describes the shape of a dragon Sturdy. "poetry. Daya. "Song Gao": "Four Hus".

"Shuowen": "Qiao, high and music. From Yao, from high province. "Poetry" says: "There are arbor in the south.""
humanum_short_description_en: The inscription of the word " Qiao " starts from ◎ "高". " Qiao " is a differentiated character of "高". The original meaning is Gao.
humanum_full_description:
「喬」字金文從◎「高」聲，「喬」是「高」的分化字，本義是高。于省吾云：「喬字的造字本義，係于高字上部附加一個曲劃，作為指事字的標志，以別于高，而仍因高字以為聲。」指事符號或作屮、止、力等形。

　　金文表示高傲，相當於文獻的「驕」，郘鐘：「余不敢為喬(驕)」，中山王鼎：「毋富而喬(驕)」，《論語．學而》：「貧而無諂，富而無驕。」「喬喬」表示強壯兇猛之貌，文獻作「蹻蹻」或「矯矯」，郘鐘：「喬喬其龍」，形容龍形之壯猛。《詩．大雅．崧高》：「四牡蹻蹻」。

　　《說文》：「喬，高而曲也。从夭，从高省。《詩》曰：『南有喬木。』」
humanum_short_description: 「喬」字金文從◎「高」聲，「喬」是「高」的分化字，本義是高。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
喬 (Simplified: 乔)
Pinyin: qiáo
English Definition: surname Qiao; tall
Total strokes: 12; Radical: 口
Pictophonetic: 夭 indicates the sound; 高 (tall) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 夭 [ yāo ] young, energetic; to die young
    • 高 [ gāo ] tall, lofty; high, elevated
Example Words:
喬木 [ qiáo mù ]: tree, esp. with recognizable trunk (as opposed to 灌木 , bush or shrub)
喬遷 [ qiáo qiān ]: to move (to a superior place); promotion
喬裝 [ qiáo zhuāng ]: to pretend; to feign; to disguise oneself
喬遷之喜 [ qiáo qiān zhī xǐ ]: congratulations on house-moving or promotion (idiom); Best wishes for your new home!

③做假，裝：喬裝。

喬字的基本解释

喬
qiáo

喬
jiāo
均见“乔”。

喬字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qiáo］
［《廣韻》巨嬌切，平宵，羣。］
［《廣韻》舉喬切，平宵，見。］
“乔1”的繁体字。
(1)高耸。多用以形容树木。
(2)木名。参见“喬梓”。
(3)矛柄靠近矛头结缨处。《诗·郑风·清人》：“二矛重喬，河上乎逍遥。”郑玄笺：“喬，矛矜近上及室題，所以懸毛羽。”一说喬通“鷮”，指野鸡毛做成的矛缨。参阅陈子展《诗经直解》、程俊英《诗经译注》。
(4)装假；虚构。
(5)形容某种恶劣的表现。有势利、刁滑、虚伪、做作等贬义。
(6)任性易怒。
(7)姓。汉有乔扈。见《後汉书·光武帝纪上》。
[②]［jiāo］
“乔2”的繁体字。通“驕1”。
骄横放纵。
[③]［jiǎo］
［《集韻》舉夭切，上小，見。］
“乔3”的繁体字。
见“喬3詰”。

喬字的康熙字典解释

【丑集上】【口字部】　喬； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页200第22
【唐韻】巨嬌切【集韻】【韻會】渠嬌切，?音僑。【說文】高而曲也，从夭从高省。【爾雅·釋木】句如羽喬。【註】樹枝曲卷，似鳥毛羽。【又】下句曰朻，上句曰喬，如木楸曰喬。【又】小枝上繚曰喬。【書·禹貢】厥木惟喬。【傳】喬，高也。【詩·周南】南有喬木。【傳】喬，上竦也。　又矛之上句曰喬。【詩·鄭風】二矛重喬。【傳】重喬，累荷也。【箋】喬，矛矜，近上及室題所以縣毛羽。　又姓。【後漢·光武紀】雲中太守喬扈。　又人名。【戰國策】世世稱孤，而有喬松之壽。【註】喬，王子喬。松，赤松。　又通橋。【詩·周南·喬木釋文】亦作橋喬。　又【廣韻】舉橋切【集韻】居妖切，?音驕。【書·禹貢惟喬釋文】喬，徐音驕。又【詩·鄭風·重喬釋文】喬，居橋反。　又與驕通。【禮·樂記】齊音敖辟喬志。【釋文】喬，音驕。本或作驕。又【表記】喬而野。　又【集韻】丘祅切，音蹺。喬詰，意不平。【莊子·在宥篇】天下始喬詰卓鷙。【釋文】喬，欽消反，或云去夭反，郭音矯，李音驕。　又【集韻】舉夭切，音矯。又祛矯

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qiáo］
["Guang Yun" Ju Jiao cut, flat night, group. ]
["Guangyun" cite Qiaoqie, Ping Xiao, see you. ]
Traditional characters for "乔1".
(1) Towering. Mostly used to describe trees.
(2) Wooden name. See "Qiao Zi".
(3) The handle of the spear is close to the tassel of the spear head. "Poetry·Zheng Feng·Qingren": "The two spears heavy Qiao, the river is almost Xiaoyao." Zheng Xuanjian: "Qiao, the spear is close to the upper and the room title, so it hangs the feathers." One said that Qiao Tong "shou", referring to the wild A spear made of chicken feathers. Refer to Chen Zizhan's "Direct Explanation of the Book of Songs" and Cheng Junying's "Annotation to the Book of Songs".
(4) Pretending to be fake; fictitious.
(5) Describe some kind of bad performance. There are derogatory meanings such as snobbery, spoiled, hypocritical, and contrived.
(6) Willful and irritable.
(7) Last name. Han has Qiao Hu. See "Book of the Later Han·The Records of Emperor Guangwu".
[②]［jiāo］
Traditional characters for "乔2". Pass "arrogance 1".
Arrogant indulgence.
[③] [jiǎo]
["Ji Yun" Ju Yao cut, Shang Xiao, see you. ]
Traditional characters for "乔3".
See "Joe 3 Cross".
Joe
